Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp

Class SMTPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connector
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Server
        • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.SMTPServer
  • public class SMTPServer
extends Server
    Connection factory for SMTP connections on a given port. This connector supports both standard SMTP (port 25) and submission service (port 587), with transparent SSL/TLS support for SMTPS.

    SMTP-specific features include:

    • CIDR-based network filtering (allow/block lists)
    • Connection rate limiting (inherited from Server)
    • Authentication rate limiting (inherited from Server)
    • Optional authentication requirement (MSA mode)
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    RFC 5321 - SMTP, RFC 6409 - Message Submission

      • getMaxRecipients

        public int getMaxRecipients()
        Returns the maximum number of recipients per transaction (RCPTMAX).

        Per RFC 5321, servers must accept at least 100 recipients. This value is advertised via the LIMITS extension (RFC 9422).

        Returns:
        the maximum recipients per transaction

      • setMaxRecipients

        public void setMaxRecipients​(int maxRecipients)
        Sets the maximum number of recipients per transaction.

        Per RFC 5321, this must be at least 100. Setting a lower value violates the specification and may cause interoperability issues.

        Parameters:
        maxRecipients - the maximum recipients (should be at least 100)

      • getMaxTransactionsPerSession

        public int getMaxTransactionsPerSession()
        Returns the maximum mail transactions per session (MAILMAX).

        A value of 0 means unlimited. This limits how many MAIL FROM commands can be issued during a single connection.

        Returns:
        the maximum transactions, or 0 for unlimited

      • setMaxTransactionsPerSession

        public void setMaxTransactionsPerSession​(int maxTransactions)
        Sets the maximum mail transactions per session.

        Set to 0 for unlimited. This can help prevent connection abuse where a single connection sends many separate messages.

        Parameters:
        maxTransactions - the maximum transactions, or 0 for unlimited

      • getRealm

        public Realm getRealm()
        Returns the authentication realm.
        Returns:
        the realm for SMTP authentication, or null if no authentication

      • setRealm

        public void setRealm​(Realm realm)
        Sets the authentication realm for SMTP AUTH.
        Parameters:
        realm - the realm to use for authentication

      • setHandlerFactory

        public void setHandlerFactory​(ClientConnectedFactory factory)
        Sets the factory for creating SMTP connection handlers. Each new connection will get its own handler instance from this factory, ensuring thread safety and state isolation between connections.
        Parameters:
        factory - the factory to create handler instances, or null for default behaviour

      • getHandlerFactory

        public ClientConnectedFactory getHandlerFactory()
        Returns the configured SMTP connection handler factory.
        Returns:
        the factory or null if none configured

      • setMailboxFactory

        public void setMailboxFactory​(MailboxFactory factory)
        Sets the factory for creating mailbox stores for local delivery.

        If configured, the mailbox factory is passed to handlers when processing RCPT TO commands, allowing them to check if recipients have local mailboxes.

        Parameters:
        factory - the mailbox factory, or null if not doing local delivery

      • getMailboxFactory

        public MailboxFactory getMailboxFactory()
        Returns the configured mailbox factory for local delivery.
        Returns:
        the factory or null if none configured

      • isAuthRequired

        public boolean isAuthRequired()
        Returns whether authentication is required for this connector.
        Returns:
        true if AUTH is mandatory, false if optional

      • setAuthRequired

        public void setAuthRequired​(boolean authRequired)
        Sets whether authentication is required. This should be true for Message Submission (port 587), false for MTA (port 25).
        Parameters:
        authRequired - true to require AUTH command before accepting mail

      • newConnection

        protected Connection newConnection​(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel,
                                   javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine)
        Creates a new SMTP connection for the given socket channel. For STARTTLS support: if secure=false but engine!=null, the connection starts as plaintext but can be upgraded with STARTTLS.
        Specified by:
        newConnection in class Connector
        Parameters:
        channel - the socket channel for the client connection
        engine - the SSL engine (null if no SSL context, non-null if STARTTLS-capable)
        Returns:
        a new SMTPConnection instance

      • isXclientAuthorized

        protected boolean isXclientAuthorized​(java.net.InetAddress clientAddress)
        Checks if the given client address is authorized to use XCLIENT extension.

        XCLIENT is a Postfix extension that allows trusted proxies to override client connection information. By default, this is disabled.

        Override this method to implement XCLIENT authorization based on your network topology (e.g., allow from specific proxy IP addresses).

        Parameters:
        clientAddress - the client's IP address
        Returns:
        true if XCLIENT is authorized, false otherwise

      • isSTARTTLSAvailable

        protected boolean isSTARTTLSAvailable()
        Checks if SSL/TLS context is available for STARTTLS.
        Returns:
        true if STARTTLS is supported, false otherwise
